current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide professional development for elementary school
		  principals in early childhood education and development.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
Professional development for
			 elementary school principals in early childhood education and
			 development

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Part A of title II of
			 the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:II/pt:A

text.#text:
The purpose of this subpart is to improve
				the knowledge of elementary school principals in areas related to early
				childhood education and development in order to—

create high
				quality early learning environments;

establish
				partnerships and collaboration with community-based early childhood education
				providers and families to better support—

learning at each
				stage;

effective
				transition among settings; and

continuous family
				engagement; and

support school
				readiness by providing high quality professional development for elementary
				school principals.

header.#text:
Definition of
				principal competencies in early childhood education and development

term.#text:
principal competencies in early childhood education and
				development

text.#text:
In this subpart, the
				term

elementary school principals must know and
				be able to do; and

are acquired through high quality
				professional development in early childhood education and developmentally
				appropriate practice.

The principal competencies in early
				childhood education and development include—

supporting an
				expanded continuum of learning through the third grade to ensure an effective
				transition from early learning or home settings to the primary school
				years;

engaging the
				school community to partner with early learning programs, and working with
				families to set a shared vision for understanding early childhood
				development;

supporting
				teachers through strong instructional leadership; and

providing safe
				and supportive early learning environments that focus on the needs of the whole
				child, including the intellectual, social, emotional, physical, and nutritional
				well-being of children; and

utilizing
				multiple measures of developmentally appropriate assessment and acquiring the
				ability to manage and use data effectively to make instructional
				decisions.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to award grants, on a
				competitive basis, to partnerships described in

to enable the
				partnerships to carry out the authorized activities described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:a/p:2
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:b

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consist of—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
A
				partnership referred to in

one or more
				public agencies, including—

a
				local educational agency;

a State
				educational agency;

a State human
				services agency;

a State lead
				agency administering a program under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Child Care and Development Block Grant
				Act of 1990
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990

text.#text:
a
				public agency administering a State funded prekindergarten program; or

a Head Start
				agency, including an Early Head Start agency; and

one or more early
				childhood education organizations that provide professional development to
				early childhood education providers.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall award a grant under this subpart for a period of not less than
				3 years.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may renew a grant under this subpart if the

determines, on
				the basis of the evaluations submitted under

, that the
				programs and activities carried out under the grant have been effective.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:e/p:1/sp:B

text.#text: The

Each partnership receiving a grant under this subpart shall
				use the grant funds—

to carry out high
				quality professional development to help elementary school principals acquire
				principal competencies in early childhood education and development in order to
				support increased school readiness for students;

to work
				collaboratively with early childhood education providers, services providers,
				and families in creating a continuum of high quality development and learning
				for children in the community and school settings.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may include
				providing professional development programs for elementary school principals,
				including mentoring programs and other means of professional learning,
				in—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:b/p:1

text.#text: The activities described in

early childhood
				education and development in all domains (including language arts and literacy,
				mathematics, emotional development, social development, approaches to learning,
				physical development, science, and creative arts), and the continuity of
				standards and high quality curriculum and teaching practices from
				prekindergarten through the third grade, with emphasis on meeting the needs of
				children with disabilities and English language learners;

collaborating
				with early childhood education providers and other community based
				organizations to provide multiple educational and social service programs to
				meet the needs of children in prekindergarten through the third grade related
				to learning and development; and

providing ongoing
				transition services for children through active family engagement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give priority to
				supporting professional development programs that target opportunities for
				elementary school principals—

text.#text:
In
				awarding grants under this subpart the

to better
				understand ways to enhance family engagement and transition strategies, improve
				transition services, and work more collaboratively with community-based early
				childhood education providers;

to create a
				continuum of high quality teaching and learning for children in prekindergarten
				through the third grade; and

to participate in
				ongoing professional development, which may include mentoring programs for
				veteran principals in the education field.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at such time, in such manner, and
				containing such information as the
may require.

Each partnership desiring a grant under this subpart
				shall submit an application to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under
shall include—

text.#text: Each application submitted to the

a description of
				the professional development for elementary school principals that will be
				provided under the grant, including how the principals will access professional
				development;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that will be
				provided in rural areas if applicable;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:d/p:2/sp:A

text.#text:
a description of
				the professional development described in

how the
				professional development will address—

child development
				and learning and the relationship of such development and learning to
				providing—

safe, supportive,
				and engaging learning environments; and

outreach and
				engagement of families in their child’s learning;

opportunities
				to collaborate with community based organizations on continuity of standards,
				curricula, family education, and transition services from community based
				settings to schools and from year to year;

collaborative
				planning to support developmentally appropriate interactions between teachers,
				children, and the families of children; and

sustainability of
				the ongoing professional development upon completion of the grant term.

assess whether
				professional development programs for elementary school principals in early
				childhood education may lead to improved school performance; and

determine how
				effective professional development programs and activities can be
				replicated.

Each partnership that receives a grant under this subpart
				shall conduct an ongoing evaluation to—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be submitted to
				the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2163/ss:e/p:1/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: annually.

text.#text:
The
				results of the evaluation described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a panel
				of leading experts in elementary and early childhood education, including
				researchers, elementary school principals, and classroom practitioners,
				to—

text.#text:
Using
				funds made available under this subpart, the

identify best
				practices in professional development for elementary school principals in early
				childhood education, and review effective coordination of professional
				development among the partnerships receiving grants under this subpart;
				and

disseminate to
				the public the latest research and findings in professional development for
				elementary school principals in early childhood education, including through
				reports and technical assistance.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply to this subpart.
